page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW OF AREA
page.content: Designated an area of outstanding natural beauty, breathtaking views can be enjoyed from the footpaths which cross the ridge. This land lies to the South/East of Swindon (which provides most of the facilities for the local population) and is situated on a ridge of sloping ground which runs from Swindon to Marlborough. Consisting of fields of crops or grazing enclosures, the soil type is predominantly chalk. There are three farms and a small group of dwellings. The general area is large and open with very few hedged boundaries; cattle usually being enclosed by wire fencing. Only one main road runs through; unmetalled tracks being the norm. The highest point at Liddington Hill is 910 ft. above sea level.
